com.github.mikephil.charting.highlight

Class Highlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mikephil.charting.highlight.Highlight

  • public class Highlight
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information needed to determine the highlighted yValue.
    Author:
    Philipp Jahoda

      • Highlight

        public Highlight(int xPx,
         int dataSet)
        constructor
        Parameters:
        xPx - the index of the highlighted yValue on the xPx-axis
        dataSet - the index of the DataSet the highlighted yValue belongs to

      • Highlight

        public Highlight(int xPx,
         int dataSet,
         int stackIndex)
        Constructor, only used for stacked-barchart.
        Parameters:
        xPx - the index of the highlighted yValue on the xPx-axis
        dataSet - the index of the DataSet the highlighted yValue belongs to
        stackIndex - references which yValue of a stacked-bar entry has been selected

      • Highlight

        public Highlight(int xPx,
         int dataSet,
         int stackIndex,
         Range range)
        Constructor, only used for stacked-barchart.
        Parameters:
        xPx - the index of the highlighted yValue on the xPx-axis
        dataSet - the index of the DataSet the highlighted yValue belongs to
        stackIndex - references which yValue of a stacked-bar entry has been selected
        range - the range the selected stack-yValue is in

      • getXIndex

        public int getXIndex()
        returns the index of the highlighted yValue on the xPx-axis
        Returns:

      • getStackIndex

        public int getStackIndex()
        Only needed if a stacked-barchart entry was highlighted. References the selected yValue within the stacked-entry.
        Returns:

      • getRange

        public Range getRange()
        Returns the range of values the selected yValue of a stacked bar is in. (this is only relevant for stacked-barchart)
        Returns:
